qas.question: When is his feast day celebrated?

answers.text: the day of the first session of the Second Vatican Council

qas.question: When did Pope Francis added his optional memorial to the worldwide General Roman Calendar of saints' feast days?
Where did Pope Francis commemorate his death on 3 June?
Where did Pope Francis commemorate his death on 4 June?

answers.text: by the Anglican Church of Canada and the Episcopal Church (United States)

qas.question: When does the United States celebrate his feast day?

plausible_answers.text: optional memorial to the worldwide General Roman Calendar of saints' feast days

qas.question: What was added by the Evangelical Lutheran Church on Thursday, 11 Sept. 2014?
Why did the Evangelical Lutheran Church add this memorial to the calendar?
What group was created by Pope Francis?
What date was Pope John Paul inagurated?

context: The Roman Catholic Church celebrates his feast day not on the date of his death, <b9_0>June 3<b9_0/>, as is usual, nor even on the day of his papal inauguration (as is sometimes done with Popes who are Saints, such as with John Paul II) but <b5_0>on <a0_0>11 October<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a1_0>the day of the first session of <b8_0>the Second Vatican Council<b8_0/><a1_0/>. This is understandable, since he was the one who had had the idea for it and had convened it. On Thursday, <a2_0>11 September 2014<a2_0/>, Pope Francis added his <b6_0>optional memorial to the worldwide General Roman Calendar of saints' feast days<b6_0/>, <b7_0>in response to global requests<b7_0/>. He is commemorated on the date of his death, 3 June, <a3_0>by the Evangelical Lutheran Church<a3_0/> in America and on the following day, 4 June, <a4_0>by the Anglican Church of Canada and the Episcopal Church (United States)<a4_0/>.
